unnormalised: **Ed Tech Buzz: Are Virtual Classrooms the New Normal, Yaar?**
normalised: **Ed Tech Buzz: Are Virtual Classrooms the New Normal, Yaar?**

unnormalised: Mumbai – Looks like online learning is here to stay, folks! Virtual classrooms are booming, with more schools and colleges across India, from IIT Delhi to small-town schools in Kerala, embracing the digital shift. Forget rushing through peak hour traffic to attend your 8 AM lecture; now you can attend lectures while sipping chai in your pajamas!

unnormalised: Reports suggest a massive surge in ed-tech platform usage post-pandemic. Many are now offering interactive sessions, personalized learning plans, and even virtual field trips to places like the Ajanta Caves.
normalised: Reports suggest a massive surge in ed-tech platform usage post-pandemic. Many are now offering interactive sessions, personalized learning plans, and even virtual field trips to places like the Ajanta Caves.

unnormalised: One Bangalore-based startup, "Shiksha Online," is even experimenting with AI-powered tutors. Imagine, instant doubt clearing, 24/7!
normalised: One Bangalore-based startup, "Shiksha Online," is even experimenting with A I-powered tutors. Imagine, instant doubt clearing, twenty four seven!

unnormalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Reliable internet access remains a challenge for many students, especially in rural areas. Some teachers also miss the personal connection of traditional classrooms.
normalised: But it's not all sunshine and roses. Reliable internet access remains a challenge for many students, especially in rural areas. Some teachers also miss the personal connection of traditional classrooms.

unnormalised: Nevertheless, the virtual classroom seems set to evolve. Imagine celebrating Onam with your virtual classmates with a virtual feast of delicious Kerala Sadya (a type of biryani)!. It's a whole new world out there! And while no one can replace good ol' chalk and talk, looks like these virtual platforms are here to support education and give that extra bit of flexibility, right?
